Exaggerate: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict appears to be exaggerated.
Understate: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict appears to be understated.
Falters at times: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict appears to falter at times.
Lack enough support: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict lacks enough support.
Problematic assumption: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict contains a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict suggests the existence of alternative explanations.
Contradict fact: None of the information provided in the claim or the expert's verdict contradicts fact.
